The 'Thirty Meter Telescope' under construction on Mauna Kea has been the site of protests, and that has led to a halt of construction work.

http://www.cbsnews.com/news/giant-hawaii-telescope-construction-halted-over-unrest/

"Astronomers say the telescope will offer a glimpse back to the beginning of time, while those against it say it represents the desecration of sacred land."

Thoughts?

Edited April 10, 2015 by r4pt0r

Seems like they were awfully quick in deciding it should go on Mauna Kea. Apparently they glazed over a few of the normal procedures for site selection and sort of butted out the opinion of the natives.

When i think that its not a huge problem to destroy and rebuild whole villages because they were build on coal a "sacred" mountain shouldnt be a problem...

Edited April 10, 2015 by Elthy
